intro: Pentsteira racemosa, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a hairy texture. The flowers, which range in color from white to purple, bloom in late spring to early summer.
